H0.text: Preventive vaccinations are how you can prevent diseases such as whooping cough and flu.

H1.text: Nutrition can prevent diseases such as whooping cough and flu.

H2.text: Exercise can help prevent diseases such as whooping cough and flu.

H3.text: Vacuuming is a way to prevent diseases such as whooping cough and flu.

A4.text: In 1974 the WHO adopted the goal of universal vaccination by 1990 to protect children against six preventable infectious diseases: measles, poliomyelitis, diphtheria, whooping cough, tetanus, and tuberculosis.

A5.text: Vaccination is the most effective method of preventing infectious diseases; widespread immunity due to vaccination is largely responsible for the worldwide eradication of smallpox and the elimination of diseases such as polio and tetanus from much of the world.
